alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:44PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF I-40 ABOUT 15 MILES WEST OF WINSLOW THROUGH 215 PM MST... At 144 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Meteor Crater, or 15 miles west of Winslow, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rimmy Jims and Meteor Crater. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 233 and 243. State Route 99 between mile markers 55 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County
